I'm definitely very basic in the fact that I enjoy *all* three major sports. I'm not lying when I say I enjoy watching a nice long game of baseball. **I GET IT**, baseball is boring. I actually don't think so, I think all it takes is to fall in love with one team and you are ready for nine months of fun!

## My Team

Similar to my reasoning about the Steelers, I makes sense that I am a Pittsburgh Pirates fan! Yes, it sucks that we have not been to the playoffs in so long. Yes, when we do make the playoffs we choke in the Wild Card round. Brandon Crawford and Jake Arrieta definitely agree.

Check these out, I guess:

Crawford's Grand Slam: [![crawford](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/VeyixHi4TW0/maxresdefault.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VeyixHi4TW0) 

Arrieta's Gem: 

[![ag](data:image/jpeg;base64,)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=XyMr0LO0PH8)


However, I do think that the Pirates future is on the upswing!

## Future

The Pirates only went 76-86 this year. A very mediocre record considering that they were in the midst of a playoff hunt for the **majority** of the summer. Except August!!

This little spur of competitve baseball in PNC Park was lead by our formidable young pitching staff. Who would want to go against:

1. Paul Skenes

2. Jared Jones

3. Mitch Keller
 
in a best-of-three playoff series? <mark>I know I wouldn't</mark>.

The only issue the Pirates seem to have is consistent hitting. We have all the young bats, but just need to unlock their power! Oneil Cruz and Bryan Reynolds are great hitters to build a lineup around! Thank god we are getting a new hitting coach this year!


If we can beat the allegations of being a non-factor in free agency this winter, I think we could be huge competitors come spring time. 

- Let's go get Pete Alonso at first base. 

-  Get some controllable outfielders with some *POP*.

- Along with that, develop Henry Davis, Ke'Bryan Hayes, and Endy Rodriguez to their **FULL** potential!


We are built to win, let's go do it!

Here's an article on how the Pirates may look in [2025](https://piratesprospects.com/2024/11/williams-pittsburgh-pirates-2024-25-offseason-outlook.html)!

Raise the Jolly Roger!
